citations.narrative:
The facility did not have adequate staffing to supervise public contact with the animals. The facility has a rectangular
shape with a central sidewalk running from one end to the other. A staff member at one end of the facility cannot
adequately supervise interactions between the animals and the public at the other. Two families, 7 people in total
consisting of adults and children, were viewing and interacting with the calves, pigs, sheep and goats which are in
enclosures at the east end of the facility. Two staff members were present at the time. One was in building near the center
of the facility where items to feed the animals are sold and the other was at the opposite end of the facility in the
enclosure with the miniature mules and positioned behind a building. Neither staff member had a view of the people or
animals at the east end nor did they attempt to move to a place where they could supervise activity even though there
were no other members of the public in the facility at the time. Failure to supervise public interactions may result in injury
to the animals or the public. During periods of public interaction, a responsible, knowledgeable, and readily identifiable
employee must be present at all times to ensure the public’s safety as well as the well-being of the animals. The facility
must have enough employees to supervise all public contact with animals at all times.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
